meanings.definition: A tool with a long curved blade used for cutting grass or crops.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a scythe to trim the tall grass in the field.
meanings.sent2: She carefully sharpened the scythe before heading out to harvest the wheat.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy scarecrow tried to use the scythe as a guitar, but it didn't make any music.
meanings.sent4: The scythe of time cuts through the fields of our lives, harvesting memories along the way.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the scythe in the sunlight was a sign that the harvest season had begun.

meanings.sent1: He had to scythe through the overgrown bushes to clear a path in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The reaper scythed through the wheat with practiced ease.
meanings.sent3: She scythed through her homework so she could go out and play.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scythe through the days, leaving only memories in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly scythed through the vegetables, preparing them for the stir-fry.
